measured_by: Harvey and Fischer's (1997) weight of advice (WOA) index
justification: The study used Harvey and Fischer's (1997) weight of advice (WOA) index to measure participants' utilization of ChatGPT's advice, which reflects algorithm appreciation. This index calculates how much participants adjusted their estimations based on the algorithmic advice.

measured_by: Harvey and Fischer's (1997) weight of advice (WOA) index
justification: The WOA index was also used to measure algorithm aversion, where lower WOA values indicated greater aversion to algorithmic advice compared to reliance on one's own judgments.

topic_or_construct: effects of explanations on advice taking
measured_by: Harvey and Fischer's (1997) weight of advice (WOA) index
justification: The index was employed to assess the impact of explanations provided by ChatGPT on participants' willingness to follow the algorithmic advice, demonstrating that explanations increased WOA.

topic_or_construct: impact of interactivity on advice taking
measured_by: Harvey and Fischer's (1997) weight of advice (WOA) index
justification: The WOA index helped reveal that the opportunity to interactively engage with ChatGPT increased participants' use of algorithmic advice, even when interactions were not fully utilized.

measured_by: Harvey and Fischer's (1997) weight of advice (WOA) index
justification: The effect of trust calibration was evaluated through WOA, where participants weighed ChatGPT's advice more if it was trustworthy, as evidenced by accurate explanations.

measured_by: Harvey and Fischer's (1997) weight of advice (WOA) index
justification: The WOA index was used to investigate how reduction in information asymmetry through additional explanations influenced participants' advice taking behavior.
